editorialSummary.text: Budget lodging where basic rooms come with free WiFi & hot breakfast, plus an exercise room.

originalText.text: A bit delayed review, but better late than never. We stayed here in easier December 2023. The rooms are super tiny and feel a bit worn. However, the front desk clerk (Stephanie I think) was great recommending places to see and was super helpful and accommodating with things we needed.

text.text: A bit delayed review, but better late than never. We stayed here in easier December 2023. The rooms are super tiny and feel a bit worn. However, the front desk clerk (Stephanie I think) was great recommending places to see and was super helpful and accommodating with things we needed.

originalText.text:
Do not use this hotel!  My 10 year old daughter and I showed up for our reserved room. Bed was disheveled. Room had not been cleaned or set for us. On top of that, the floors, walls, baseboards, etc. looked gross!

Went back downstairs to be told that no service was on at that time, and no other rooms available. And that the clerk could not give us clean linens or make our bed.

Hindsight is that it was good not to stay there anyway. Shady characters, dogs, etc. coming in and out as we tried to locate another hotel by phone. Hotel did not seem safe to be around anyway. By this time it was midnight.

Still haven’t received a refund for the two nights I paid for. Zero compensation or apologies from management. Nothing.

Highly recommend you look elsewhere.

originalText.text: Great location and decent breakfast, and just that. The rooms are very small, we could barely walk inside, the bathtub drain was clogged and the cleaning in general ain’t great. Other than that, the smoke detectors inside our room were covered with plastic bags, which makes no sense.

text.text: Great location and decent breakfast, and just that. The rooms are very small, we could barely walk inside, the bathtub drain was clogged and the cleaning in general ain’t great. Other than that, the smoke detectors inside our room were covered with plastic bags, which makes no sense.

originalText.text:
Obviously people are staying here for the location. It’s very close to Times Square and even closer to the park. It’s more affordable than most but it’s still not cheap. Especially for what you’re getting teeny tiny rooms no parking no restaurant. I couldn’t figure out how to turn the heat on. They said maybe turn on the window unit that did not work and then the floorboard unit did not work either.
But they are remodeling slowly, so maybe I’ll try it again later.
But it’s nice to have the location . The coffee is terrible but there’s a really great coffee and juice shop just down the block.

But it’s nice to have the location . The coffee is terrible but there’s a really great coffee and juice shop just down the block.

originalText.text:
Unfortunately we had a very negative experience here. The location is amazing, but the rooms and service leave a lot to be desired. There was an iron but no ironing board; when I called down about it, they told me they were all out of ironing boards (what?). We had to use the top of our dresser.  The TV didn't work but we didn't even bother calling down about that after the ironing board experience. The toilet made noise constantly through the night as the bowl refilled over and over again. Finally, about the only things that were clean in our room were the linens. Even the toilet bowl and shower had a healthy layer of grime.

Considering I paid to stay here what I would pay to stay in a 5-star hotel in most parts of the world (granted, on NYC marathon weekend), I was disappointed. I knew I would be getting the 2 star, no-frills motel experience,  but even basic cleanliness was lacking.
